intro: Ononis cuatrecasasii, commonly known as the Cuatrecasas's sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
